title: Angelina Jolie shops in discount store with 3 of her kids as she films new Marvel movie

Angelina Jolie has been spotted bargain-hunting in a discount store as she takes a break from filming her new Marvel movie.

The 44-year-old enjoyed a day off in Fuerteventura, where she is filming The Eternals.

She brought her three of her six kids - Zahara, 14, and twins Vivienne and Knox, both 11.

They could be seen browsing in the aisles of the local supermarket on the Spanish island, while Angie wore a loose white sun dress and enormous sunglasses.

Pushing round a shopping trolley packed to the brim, the family picked out their groceries in the budget store.

(Image: GTres / SplashNews.com)

(Image: SWNS.COM)

Angelina will play superhero Thena in the new Marvel flick, who in the comics is an Eternal with the powers of superhuman speed, strength, durability, regeneration,energy blasts, flight, illusion generation, matter transmutation, mind control, telekinesis, telepathy, and teleportation.

She will work alongside a cast including Salma Hayek, Richard Madden and Scarlett Johansson and Kit Harington.

Kit's character Dane Whitman wields a mystical sword that is cursed, taking his name from a villainous ancestor in the hopes of restoring honour to his family, whilst also having a romance with the Eternal known as Sersi, who will be played by Gemma Chan in the film.

(Image: Getty Images for Disney)

Angelina Jolie recently spoke to MirrorOnline exclusively about motherhood and her fears that she had to be a perfect parent.

The Hollywood star opened up at the premiere of her new Maleficent film, Mistress of Evil.

Her character, Maleficent, is adoptive mother to Princess Aurora, and their power struggle as Aurora grows up is an important part of the story.

(Image: Getty Images)

Angelina said the film tells us that parenthood "isn't easy", and that a lot of mothers worry about if they are doing a good job, herself included.

"Even Maleficent can have trouble and worry whether or not she's a good enough mom, and worry about what it means to be a mom", she said.

"In her mind she has this idea, we probably all do - I know I did before I had kids - that to be a perfect mother you have to be a perfect person. And that's not true."

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

Instead, Angelina says "you have to just do your best and be willing to put your child before you".

"She loves being a mom, and I do too", she added.

"It's my everything."
description: Holywood superstar Angelina Jolie proves she's just like us as she pops down to a discount supermarket to grab some essentials
